page.title: 16Wormleighton the Manor House
page.content: The Manor House was built at the beginning of the sixteenth century by the Spencer Family and the first Lord Spencer added the gatehouse built with marlstone from the escarpment at Stoneton. A large part of the house was burnt down during the civil war but one wing remains still inhabited. This wing also contains a Star Chamber which was used as a magisterial court until 1641 when Star Chamber Courts were discontinued by James 1. The Manor House is now used as a farmhouse and the gatehouse provides rented accommodation for two families.
